Thanks for the reply.

Currently, I'm trying to replace a crawler I wrote myself with
Heretrix. :)

It's mostly the static fields in Heretrix.java that are problematic. 
    These fields can only be properly initialized by calling main(),
which is a little awkward.   Additionally, since these fields are
static there can be no alternate configuration implementations.

I'll work on a patch that illustrates this.  It will be a simple
refactoring of Heretrix.java, and you can commit it if you like.

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
> Joshua Davis wrote:
> 
> >I'm trying to use Heretrix embedded in another Java program rather
> >than from the command line and I'm finding it difficult to get
> >Heretrix to initialize.   Looking at the source code, I see a lot
of
> >static fields in Heretrix.java that need to be initialized in ways
> >that are only accessible from the outside from the main() method.
> >
> >I think Heretrix would be more flexible if these static
configuration
> >parameters were in a single instance, or better yet, behind an
> >interface that outsiders (like myself) could implement.
> >
> >Just an idea.  What do you think?
> >
> We could do that.  Or perhaps it'd be better if they could be 
> initialized from a properties file or system properties.  Tell us
more 
> where you're having problems (or send a patch that illlustrates
what 
> you'd like changed).
> 
> Thanks for the feedback,
> St.Ack
